name: Introduction to Physics
description: A broad introduction to the study of physics, covering topics such as motion, Newton's laws of motion, thermodynamics, energy, electricity, magnetism, waves, optics, and relativity.

name: Classical Mechanics
description: A course providing an in-depth study of classical mechanics, including topics such as Newton's laws of motion, kinematics, momentum, energy, momentum conservation, angular momentum, central force, and gravitation.

name: Electromagnetism
description: A course providing a study of electricity, magnetism, and electromagnetic fields, including topics such as electric and magnetic fields, Maxwell's equations, electromagnetic waves, and the propagation of light.

name: Special Relativity
description: A course providing an in-depth study of special relativity, including topics such as the Lorentz transformation, time dilation, length contraction, and the equivalence of mass and energy.
